intro: Pothuava squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa pothuava, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the genus. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
